source.name: Blockchain Use Cases in DeFi
source.instructions: Which of the following is NOT a primary use case of blockchain technology in decentralized finance (DeFi)?

answers.answer: Enabling peer-to-peer lending and borrowing platforms
Facilitating decentralized exchanges (DEXs) for cryptocurrency trading
Providing a centralized authority to oversee all financial transactions
Supporting the creation and management of stablecoins
Allowing for tokenization of real-world assets

source.guidance: The correct answer is "Providing a centralized authority to oversee all financial transactions" because this goes against the fundamental principle of decentralization in DeFi. Blockchain technology in DeFi aims to eliminate centralized authorities and intermediaries. The other options are all valid use cases of blockchain in DeFi: peer-to-peer lending platforms (like Aave and Compound), decentralized exchanges (like Uniswap), stablecoins (like USDT and USDC), and asset tokenization are all key applications of blockchain in the DeFi ecosystem. These use cases leverage blockchain's ability to provide transparent, secure, and decentralized financial services without the need for traditional intermediaries.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT analyze and differentiate between various blockchain use cases in decentralized finance (DeFi)
